title: Julius Caesar defeats Caecilius Metellus Scipio and Marcus Porcius Cato (Cato the Younger) in the battle of Thapsus.
text: Julius Caesar defeats Caecilius Metellus Scipio and Marcus Porcius Cato (Cato the Younger) in the battle of Thapsus.

title: Stilicho stymies the Visigoths under Alaric in the Battle of Pollentia.
text: Stilicho stymies the Visigoths under Alaric in the Battle of Pollentia.

title: King Richard I of England dies from an infection following the removal of an arrow from his shoulder.
text: King Richard I of England dies from an infection following the removal of an arrow from his shoulder.

title: Seventh Crusade: Ayyubids of Egypt capture King Louis IX of France in the Battle of Fariskur.
text: Seventh Crusade: Ayyubids of Egypt capture King Louis IX of France in the Battle of Fariskur.

title: The Scots reaffirm their independence by signing the Declaration of Arbroath.
text: The Scots reaffirm their independence by signing the Declaration of Arbroath.

title: The poet Petrarch first sees his idealized love, Laura, in the church of Saint Clare in Avignon.
text: The poet Petrarch first sees his idealized love, Laura, in the church of Saint Clare in Avignon.

title: John, Master of the Order of Aviz, is made king John I of Portugal.
text: John, Master of the Order of Aviz, is made king John I of Portugal.

title: Mehmed II begins his siege of Constantinople (Istanbul), which falls on May 29.
text: Mehmed II begins his siege of Constantinople (Istanbul), which falls on May 29.

title: One of the largest earthquakes recorded in the history of England, Flanders, or Northern France, takes place.
text: One of the largest earthquakes recorded in the history of England, Flanders, or Northern France, takes place.

title: At the Cape of Good Hope, Dutch sailor Jan van Riebeeck establishes a resupply camp that eventually becomes Cape Town.
text: At the Cape of Good Hope, Dutch sailor Jan van Riebeeck establishes a resupply camp that eventually becomes Cape Town.

title: The New York Slave Revolt of 1712 begins near Broadway.
text: The New York Slave Revolt of 1712 begins near Broadway.

title: American Revolutionary War: Ships of the Continental Navy fail in their attempt to capture a Royal Navy dispatch boat.
text: American Revolutionary War: Ships of the Continental Navy fail in their attempt to capture a Royal Navy dispatch boat.

title: King Buddha Yodfa Chulaloke (Rama I) of Siam (modern day Thailand) establishes the Chakri dynasty.
text: King Buddha Yodfa Chulaloke (Rama I) of Siam (modern day Thailand) establishes the Chakri dynasty.

title: During the French Revolution, the Committee of Public Safety becomes the executive organ of the republic.
text: During the French Revolution, the Committee of Public Safety becomes the executive organ of the republic.

title: John Jacob Astor incorporates the American Fur Company, that would eventually make him America's first millionaire.
text: John Jacob Astor incorporates the American Fur Company, that would eventually make him America's first millionaire.

title: British forces under the command of the Duke of Wellington assault the fortress of Badajoz. This would be the turning point in the Peninsular War against Napoleon-led France.
text: British forces under the command of the Duke of Wellington assault the fortress of Badajoz. This would be the turning point in the Peninsular War against Napoleon-led France.

title: Nominal beginning of the Bourbon Restoration; anniversary date that Napoleon abdicates and is exiled to Elba.
text: Nominal beginning of the Bourbon Restoration; anniversary date that Napoleon abdicates and is exiled to Elba.

title: Church of Christ, the original church of the Latter Day Saint movement, is organized by Joseph Smith and others at either Fayette or Manchester, New York.
text: Church of Christ, the original church of the Latter Day Saint movement, is organized by Joseph Smith and others at either Fayette or Manchester, New York.

title: U.S. President John Tyler is sworn in, two days after having become President upon William Henry Harrison's death.
text: U.S. President John Tyler is sworn in, two days after having become President upon William Henry Harrison's death.

title: The Reorganized Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints, later renamed Community of Christ, is organized by Joseph Smith III and others at Amboy, Illinois.
text: The Reorganized Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints, later renamed Community of Christ, is organized by Joseph Smith III and others at Amboy, Illinois.

title: First performance of Arthur Sullivan's debut success, his suite of incidental music for The Tempest, leading to a career that included the famous Gilbert and Sullivan operas.
text: First performance of Arthur Sullivan's debut success, his suite of incidental music for The Tempest, leading to a career that included the famous Gilbert and Sullivan operas.

title: American Civil War: The Battle of Shiloh begins: In Tennessee, forces under Union General Ulysses S. Grant meet Confederate troops led by General Albert Sidney Johnston.
text: American Civil War: The Battle of Shiloh begins: In Tennessee, forces under Union General Ulysses S. Grant meet Confederate troops led by General Albert Sidney Johnston.

title: American Civil War: The Battle of Sailor's Creek: Confederate General Robert E. Lee's Army of Northern Virginia fights and loses its last major battle while in retreat from Richmond, Virginia during the Appomattox Campaign.
text: American Civil War: The Battle of Sailor's Creek: Confederate General Robert E. Lee's Army of Northern Virginia fights and loses its last major battle while in retreat from Richmond, Virginia during the Appomattox Campaign.

title: The Grand Army of the Republic, an American patriotic organization composed of Union veterans of the American Civil War, is founded. It lasts until 1956.
text: The Grand Army of the Republic, an American patriotic organization composed of Union veterans of the American Civil War, is founded. It lasts until 1956.

title: Celluloid is patented.
text: Celluloid is patented.

title: Thomas Green Clemson dies, bequeathing his estate to the State of South Carolina to establish Clemson Agricultural College.
text: Thomas Green Clemson dies, bequeathing his estate to the State of South Carolina to establish Clemson Agricultural College.

title: Salt Lake Temple of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is dedicated by Wilford Woodruff.
text: Salt Lake Temple of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is dedicated by Wilford Woodruff.

title: Oscar Wilde is arrested in the Cadogan Hotel, London, after losing a libel case against the Marquess of Queensberry.
text: Oscar Wilde is arrested in the Cadogan Hotel, London, after losing a libel case against the Marquess of Queensberry.

title: In Athens, the opening of the first modern Olympic Games is celebrated, 1,500 years after the original games are banned by Roman emperor Theodosius I.
text: In Athens, the opening of the first modern Olympic Games is celebrated, 1,500 years after the original games are banned by Roman emperor Theodosius I.

title: Robert Peary and Matthew Henson reach the North Pole.
text: Robert Peary and Matthew Henson reach the North Pole.

title: During the Battle of Deçiq, Dedë Gjon Luli Dedvukaj, leader of the Malësori Albanians, raises the Albanian flag in the town of Tuzi, Montenegro, for the first time after George Kastrioti (Skanderbeg).
text: During the Battle of Deçiq, Dedë Gjon Luli Dedvukaj, leader of the Malësori Albanians, raises the Albanian flag in the town of Tuzi, Montenegro, for the first time after George Kastrioti (Skanderbeg).

title: World War I: The United States declares war on Germany (see President Woodrow Wilson's address to Congress).
text: World War I: The United States declares war on Germany (see President Woodrow Wilson's address to Congress).

title: Varney Airlines makes its first commercial flight (Varney is the root company of United Airlines).
text: Varney Airlines makes its first commercial flight (Varney is the root company of United Airlines).

title: Huey P. Long, Governor of Louisiana, is impeached by the Louisiana House of Representatives.
text: Huey P. Long, Governor of Louisiana, is impeached by the Louisiana House of Representatives.

title: At the end of the Salt March, Gandhi raises a lump of mud and salt and declares, "With this, I am shaking the foundations of the British Empire."[1]
text: At the end of the Salt March, Gandhi raises a lump of mud and salt and declares, "With this, I am shaking the foundations of the British Empire."[1]

title: Tupelo–Gainesville tornado outbreak: Another tornado from the same storm system as the Tupelo tornado hits Gainesville, Georgia, killing 203.
text: Tupelo–Gainesville tornado outbreak: Another tornado from the same storm system as the Tupelo tornado hits Gainesville, Georgia, killing 203.

title: World War II: Nazi Germany launches Operation 25 (the invasion of Kingdom of Yugoslavia) and Operation Marita (the invasion of Greece).
text: World War II: Nazi Germany launches Operation 25 (the invasion of Kingdom of Yugoslavia) and Operation Marita (the invasion of Greece).

title: World War II: Sarajevo is liberated from German and Croatian forces by the Yugoslav Partisans.
text: World War II: Sarajevo is liberated from German and Croatian forces by the Yugoslav Partisans.

title: World War II: The Battle of Slater's Knoll on Bougainville comes to an end.
text: World War II: The Battle of Slater's Knoll on Bougainville comes to an end.

title: The first Tony Awards are presented for theatrical achievement.
text: The first Tony Awards are presented for theatrical achievement.

title: Greek shipping tycoon Aristotle Onassis buys the Hellenic National Airlines (TAE) and founds Olympic Airlines.
text: Greek shipping tycoon Aristotle Onassis buys the Hellenic National Airlines (TAE) and founds Olympic Airlines.

title: Launch of Early Bird, the first commercial communications satellite to be placed in geosynchronous orbit.
text: Launch of Early Bird, the first commercial communications satellite to be placed in geosynchronous orbit.

title: In Richmond, Indiana's downtown district, a double explosion kills 41 and injures 150.
text: In Richmond, Indiana's downtown district, a double explosion kills 41 and injures 150.

title: Pierre Elliott Trudeau wins the Liberal Leadership Election, and becomes Prime Minister of Canada soon after.
text: Pierre Elliott Trudeau wins the Liberal Leadership Election, and becomes Prime Minister of Canada soon after.

title: Newhall massacre: Four California Highway Patrol officers are killed in a shootout.
text: Newhall massacre: Four California Highway Patrol officers are killed in a shootout.

title: Vietnam War: Easter Offensive: American forces begin sustained air strikes and naval bombardments.
text: Vietnam War: Easter Offensive: American forces begin sustained air strikes and naval bombardments.

title: Launch of Pioneer 11 spacecraft.
text: Launch of Pioneer 11 spacecraft.

title: The American League of Major League Baseball begins using the designated hitter.
text: The American League of Major League Baseball begins using the designated hitter.

title: The Swedish pop band ABBA wins the Eurovision Song Contest with the song "Waterloo", launching their international career.
text: The Swedish pop band ABBA wins the Eurovision Song Contest with the song "Waterloo", launching their international career.

title: Student protests break out in Nepal.
text: Student protests break out in Nepal.

title: Members of Cameroon's Republican Guard unsuccessfully attempt to overthrow the government headed by Paul Biya.
text: Members of Cameroon's Republican Guard unsuccessfully attempt to overthrow the government headed by Paul Biya.

title: The Bosnian War begins.
text: The Bosnian War begins.

title: The Rwandan genocide begins when the aircraft carrying Rwandan president Juvénal Habyarimana and Burundian president Cyprien Ntaryamira is shot down.
text: The Rwandan genocide begins when the aircraft carrying Rwandan president Juvénal Habyarimana and Burundian president Cyprien Ntaryamira is shot down.

title: Nuclear weapons testing: Pakistan tests medium-range missiles capable of reaching India.
text: Nuclear weapons testing: Pakistan tests medium-range missiles capable of reaching India.

title: Travelers Group announces an agreement to undertake the $76 billion merger between Travelers and Citicorp, and the merger is completed on October 8, of that year, forming Citibank.
text: Travelers Group announces an agreement to undertake the $76 billion merger between Travelers and Citicorp, and the merger is completed on October 8, of that year, forming Citibank.

title: Rolandas Paksas becomes the first president of Lithuania to be peacefully removed from office by impeachment.
text: Rolandas Paksas becomes the first president of Lithuania to be peacefully removed from office by impeachment.

title: Kurdish leader Jalal Talabani becomes Iraqi president; Shiite Arab Ibrahim al-Jaafari is named premier the next day.
text: Kurdish leader Jalal Talabani becomes Iraqi president; Shiite Arab Ibrahim al-Jaafari is named premier the next day.

title: The 2008 Egyptian general strike starts led by Egyptian workers later to be adopted by April 6 Youth Movement and Egyptian activists.
text: The 2008 Egyptian general strike starts led by Egyptian workers later to be adopted by April 6 Youth Movement and Egyptian activists.

title: A 6.3 magnitude earthquake strikes near L'Aquila, Italy, killing 307.
text: A 6.3 magnitude earthquake strikes near L'Aquila, Italy, killing 307.

title: Maoist rebels kill 76 CRPF officers in Dantewada district, India.
text: Maoist rebels kill 76 CRPF officers in Dantewada district, India.

title: In San Fernando, Tamaulipas, Mexico, over 193 victims of Los Zetas were exhumed from several mass graves.
text: In San Fernando, Tamaulipas, Mexico, over 193 victims of Los Zetas were exhumed from several mass graves.

title: Azawad declares itself independent from the Republic of Mali.
text: Azawad declares itself independent from the Republic of Mali.

title: U.S. military launches 59 Tomahawk cruise missiles at an air base in Syria. Russia describes the strikes as an "aggression", adding they significantly damage US-Russia ties.[2]

title: A bus carrying the Humboldt Broncos junior ice hockey team collides with a semi-truck in Saskatchewan, Canada, killing 16 people and injuring 13 others.
